text: Slightly hazy golden body with nice large lasting white head. Aroma is very fruity with some malts in the background. Taste is malts grains and fruits. Aftertaste is nice bitter.
Bottle - Pale malts and lychee. Cloudy gold with a decent off white head. Sweet hoppy notes, touch of lychee and peel with a nice light bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle 330ml. @ home on the terrace. [ As Mikkeller Øllen om Bogen ].Light unclear medium orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, hop oil, orange - citrus. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, spicy hops, hop oil, citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140728]

Pours hazy gold with one finger of loose white head, excellent retention, moderate lacing. (4/5) Nose is dank weedy hops, pithy citrus, very faint crackery pale malt. (9/10) Taste is mild sweet, strong bitter. (9/10) Light to medium body, prickly to moderate carbonation, long bitter finish. (4/5)

To be honest, the only reason I bought this was to see if theres a beer style so boring, Mikkeller cant do anything with it. Damn you Mikkeller! You managed to make a near-hop bomb out of a low gravity pale lager? What the hell is up with that? Great beer. Probably the best lager Ive ever had. (18/20)

Bottle from Mane Liquor shared with Gooding. As with all Pils/Lagers from Mikkeller, this is a winner. Probably not as clean or hop driven as El Celler or American Dream but still driven by the hops and goes down in a balanced fashion. Have always enjoyed his lighter hop driven lagers and this is another going down well. Winner

Flaska (tack NordicV). Lätt dimmig ljus bärnsten, med ett medelstort vitt skum. Mycket citrus i doften, ackompanjerat av blomster, kåda och gräs. Smakinslag av citrus, grapefrukt, gräs och säd. Trevlig beska. Något tunn kropp. Torr munkänsla.
Bottle. Hazy lemon-yellow with a creamy white head. Crackery pale malts with a zippy white grapefruit hop character, finishing more dry than bitter. Yeah, I could pound this.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle. Hazy dark amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hosp, citrus, grapefruit, caramel and a little floral. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, caramel, grapefruit, little pine, little thin, bitter, little grainy and a little sweet.

330ml brown bottle. Deep gold pour, some haze. Low sitting soapy white cap, good lace. Nose has some fruitiness and citrus. Taste has dryish grains, light fruits and a grassy note toward the end. Light hop aftertaste. Decent lager.
Bottle sample bought and shared with kraddel. Pours cloudy amber/yellow with white head. Aroma is hoppy. Medium to strong bitterness. Taste very hoppy.

Bottle shared with st247 

Pours unclear light amber . 
Small white head 
Smell is green , pine almost , very vefetable . 
Taste is green , straight bitter , vegetable . Simple , and been done so much before ..
33cl bottle from cerveteca. Orange color. Thin head. Medium bitterness. Fizzy body. Hoppy, resiny, fruity.

Bottle from De Hopduvel, Ghent. Hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 260714

330ml bottle pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is grainy with some grapefruit and tropical fruity notes. Taste is a fruity and grainy malty sweetness underneath a bold grapefruit and pine hop bitterness. Light to medium bodied with generous carbonation. A very well crafted brew which is quite tasty and more like an IPA than anything else. Quite hoppy.

Bottle @ home. Clear dark orange color, full sized off-white head that lasts for quite a while. Aroma is lightly malts, nicely hoppy with tones of tropical fruit, a hint of blossom and quite floral. Taste lightly malts, again nicely hoppy and fruity and very bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Nothing like a normal pilsener off course but I dont care, I like it!

Bottle @ Home. Bought at DØE14. Clear orange, big white head that settles nicely, some lacing. Aroma, malty, hoppy, pine, grapefruit, caramel. Similar taste. Dry mouth feel. Medium to high carbonation.
Bärnstensfärgad med litet ljust skum som stannar kvar runt glaset. Doftar tropiska frukter mest annanas och grapefrukt! Krispig och väldigt besk. Mer som en ipa än lager! Riktigt bra!

Pours amber with a foamy white head. Aroma is nice and hoppy with tropical notes of fresh oranges, mild pineapple, lemon peel and weak melon. Clean and fresh hop juice! Taste is clean and pilsner-like with hoppy and tropical notes added. Nothing is off here. An awesome balance and a dangerously high drinkability! This is like a little brother of the epic "vesterbro pilsner" .
Bottle at World Cup Brazil tasting. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Grain, hay, malt, light hops. More hops and it would be good.
Bottle @ World Cup Tasting @ Hallinghansen. Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. Grapefruit, pine and straw. Dry, crisp and hoppy. Very drinkable.

3rd May 2014Bottle in my Copenhagen hotel room. Hazy gold beer, good pale cream coloured head. Palate is airy and dry. Light floralness. Light citric hops - grapefruit pith and light pine. Finishes dry with pithy bitterness. Not bad.

@ Havregatan. Flaska (330 ml) från Kihoskh, Köpenhamn (34 DKK). Fruktig och humlig, persika och tallbarr, tydlig beska, krispig, frisk och fräsch, medelfyllig, oljig i konsistensen. Avslutningen är torr och besk med fruktiga och humliga toner. En trevlig och humlig lager.

ivorywhite head fades fast with some structured lacing. orange blond colour. aroma of burnt plastics, mais, hoppy, grapefruit and skunky. taste is like the aroma with a pronounced long bitter finish. rather thin body, medium carbonation. bottle 33 cl / bbf apr-2016

24/V/14 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ Procrastinated Spontan Gent Tasting - BB: 1/IV/16 (2014-532) Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Clear orange beer, creamy off-white solid head, stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: exotic fruits, sweet mango, pineapple, passion fruit, citrus. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very fruity, hoppy, citrus, bit sourish, nice bitter hops, grapefruit, exotic fruits. Aftertaste: very bitter, fruity notes, citrus, grassy.

Bottle, bought @ Kihoskh, Cph. Pours orange amber with a small, creamy, white head. Aroma has nice fresh hops, grapefruit, apricot, resin. Medium carbonation, light and kinda nice dry mouthfeel. Flavour is elegant, hoppy and dry, apricot, citrus, resin. Elegant, pleasant and fresh.

Bottle at home. High fluffy white and long lasting head. Hazy orange body. Powerful dry fruity oranges hops aroma. Highly carbonated grapefruit pine flavor with a good deal of hops bitterness and a long dry and bitter finish.

Flaske, 33 cl.. Tåget orange-gylden, hvidt knitrende skum. Frisk og humlet næse. Appelsin-og citrus-noter. Det er også humlen, der har førertrøjen i smagen. Dejlig, frisk og sprød pilsner med en lav ABV. Ikke så mange dikke-darer.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are pine, citrus, and caramel - with a slightly bitter finish.

Thanks to tderoeck for picking up this one from Hopduvel. 33 cl. bottle split with 2 @ Procrastinated Spontaneity // 2 Boekjes tasting @ Gent. Hazy orange with a milky, creamy white head. Nose is huge juicy and sweet mango and exotic fruits hops, very juicy with pine resin and some caramel sweetness underneath. Juicy exotic / multi-fruit taste with mango pine resin, grapefruit, touch sweeter dark bread, faint grass, nicely lingering aftertaste. Drinks like water, light very easy to drink body. Wonderful, I seem to really love IPL & I seem to prefer them strongly to IPAs.
33 cl bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and crips fruity, peachy and light peachy. Dense hoppy, fruity and peachy. Bitter and citrusy. Lingering fruity finish.
Bottle @ home, thanks PMgep! Aroma is herbal and piney hops, some citrus notes, faint malt note. Flavour is dry and hoppy, fruity, floral and piney notes, light caramel malt note. Nice one.

duft: citrus. lime. blomster. en smule duft af bagegær
smag: sød. lime, appelsin. orangeskal. græs. tør humle bitterhed

Bottle fom M&F Bottle Shop. Pours a clear golden with a frothy white head. Mellow sweet- and dryness. Mellow, but still dominated by, sprucy hops aromas. Also some grain aromas. Medium to light bodied. Soft carbonation. Dry finish.
33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2014, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, malty/bitter and slightly fruity/woody, easy to drink, balanced, clear, good head, good brew

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden pale amber color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends, May 2014. 

Clear golden with a large white head. Fresh and hoppy with citrus, bread and grass. Easy to drink with a fairly dry finish.

Amber clear. One finger foam. Mild floral citrus us! Hoppy aromas. No dry hop feeling. Dry. Medium bitter for a mikkeller brew. Very easy to drink a lot of. I got the book signed by "the man".

Bottle at home.
Hazy orange coloured with a medium sized off-white head.
Fruity aroma of peaches, citrus peel and hops with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops and pine needles with notes of caramel and zest. 
Dry hoppy finish.
Bottle at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear yellow - white head. Fresh hoppy. Oiley - fresh hoppy. Crispy. Bitterness. Resin. Toasted notes. Very green. Nice grassy. Lovely high drinkability.

06.05.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is fresh grassy, newly cut lawn, leafs, fresh hops, citrus peel, sap, bark, hints of pine needles. Taste is slightly dry grassy, newly cut lawn, fresh hops, bark, leafs, sap, pine needles, hints of citrus peel. Longlasting mild bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice and refreshing.
